meanings.definition: The point where the perpendicular bisectors of a triangle intersect, equidistant from the three vertices.
meanings.sent1: In geometry class, we learned that the circumcenter is where the lines cutting a triangle in half meet.
meanings.sent2: The circumcenter of a triangle is always the same distance from each of its corners.
meanings.sent3: At the party, the circumcenter of the room was where everyone gathered to chat.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like the circumcenter of joy, spreading equally to all around her.
meanings.sent5: The bright light at the circumcenter of the stage drew all eyes towards it.
